original: Bihl, Yngve Birger, musikdirektör, Borås, f. 10/6/08 i Sthlm av grosshandl. Birger B. o. Erika Olsson. G. 38 m. Eleonora de Floer. Barn: Berit f. 40, Olof 42. — Stud. v. norra latin i Sthlm 18-27, musikhögsk. där 27-35, kapell-mäst :volontär v. Operan 35-37. Stud:-res. t. Danm. 33, 34 o. 39, Tyskl. o. Ital. 36-39. Organist o. körled. i Li-dingö-Brevik 31, musiklär. v. Strängnäs h. a. 1. 36-40, v. Kristinehamns h. a. 1. 40-46, v. Borås h. a. 1. sed. 46. Musiklär. v. Hantverkssk. f. blinda män i Kristinehamn 42-46. Medl. av Odd Fellow o. Rotarykl. Utg.: manskvartetter, klavérstycken, kantaterna Det ljusa landet o. Staden v. Varnan 42, Bjurtjärnskantat 42, Kantat v. Kristinehamns hand:fören. 40-årsjub. 44, komp. f. kör, sång o. div. instrument, pianotrio, orgelsonat etc. Hobbies: mykologi, cykelfärder.
translated: Bihl, Yngve Birger, musical director, Borås, born on June 10, 1908 in Stockholm to merchant Birger B. and Erika Olsson. Married in 1938 to Eleonora de Floer. Children: Berit born in 1940, Olof born in 1942. Yngve studied at Norra Latin in Stockholm from 1918 to 1927 and at the Stockholm Music Academy from 1927 to 1935. He was a volunteer chapel master at the Opera from 1935 to 1937. He went on study trips to Denmark in 1933, 1934, and 1939, and to Germany and Italy from 1936 to 1939. He was an organist and choir leader in Lidingö-Brevik in 1931, a music teacher at Strängnäs high school from 1936 to 1940, at Kristinehamn high school from 1940 to 1946, and at Borås high school from 1946. He was also a music teacher at the Craftsmen's School for Blind Men in Kristinehamn from 1942 to 1946. He was a member of the Odd Fellow and Rotary clubs. His publications included male quartets, piano pieces, and cantatas "Det ljusa landet" and "Staden v. Varnan" in 1942, "Bjurtjärnskantat" in 1942, and a cantata for the Kristinehamn Handicraft Society's 40th anniversary in 1944. He composed for choir, solo singing, and various instruments, as well as piano trio, organ sonata, etc. His hobbies included mycology and cycling.

structured.name: Yngve Birger Bihl
structured.description: Yngve Birger Bihl was a Swedish musical director who was born in Stockholm on June 10, 1908. He was married to Eleonora de Floer in 1938 and had two children, Berit and Olof. He studied at Norra Latin in Stockholm from 1918 to 1927 and at the Stockholm Music Academy from 1927 to 1935. He was a volunteer chapel master at the Opera from 1935 to 1937. He went on study trips to Denmark in 1933, 1934, and 1939, and to Germany and Italy from 1936 to 1939. He was an organist and choir leader in Lidingö-Brevik in 1931, a music teacher at Strängnäs high school from 1936 to 1940, at Kristinehamn high school from 1940 to 1946, and at Borås high school from 1946. He was also a music teacher at the Craftsmen's School for Blind Men in Kristinehamn from 1942 to 1946. He was a member of the Odd Fellow and Rotary clubs and his works include male quartets, piano pieces, and cantatas such as Det ljusa landet and Staden v. Varnan in 1942, Bjurtjärnskantat in 1942, and a cantata for the Kristinehamn Handicraft Society's 40th anniversary in 1944. He composed for choir, solo singing, and various instruments, as well as piano trio, organ sonata, etc. His hobbies included mycology and cycling.
